definition: to inhale/to draw in breath
to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
inhaler

sentences.english: Rotate the left arm forward while inhaling.
With each in breath, you are breathing in love and renewal.
sentences.chinese: 在每次吸氣中，你都正吸入愛和恢復之力。

sentences.english: The way to over come nervousness is to breathe in deep and breathe out slowly for some times.
sentences.chinese: 克服緊張的辦法是調勻呼吸，深吸氣，慢呼出。

sentences.english: Reads the festival with the time aspirated engine.
Breathe chaotically through the nose, concentrating always on exhalation. The body will take care of the inhalation.
sentences.chinese: 快速地透過鼻子吸氣與吐氣，重點放在吐氣上。

sentences.english: “Smell the air,” I said. I mimed inhaling deeply.
sentences.chinese: “聞一下，”我說，做出深深吸氣的樣子。

sentences.english: As I inhale the impalpable breezes that set in upon me.
sentences.chinese: 迎隱晦之風我猛吸氣輕風盪漾心旗。

sentences.english: As you inhale, press in with your thumbs and bring your hips forward.
sentences.chinese: 當你吸氣時，用拇指壓住然後把你的腰往前傾。

sentences.english: During inhalation , contraction of the intercostal muscles elevates the ribs.
sentences.chinese: 吸氣時肋間肌收縮，提起肋骨。

sentences.english: Two arms curving and inspiration, supporting and expiration.
sentences.chinese: 兩臂彎曲時吸氣，撐直時呼氣。

sentences.english: Inhale, slide the hips forwards, and arch the head and chest up into the Cobra pose (see pp. 64-5).
sentences.chinese: 吸氣，臀部往前推，頭向前仰並擴胸，成眼鏡蛇式。

sentences.english: Mixers are available for a wide variety of naturally aspirated and turbocharged engines.
sentences.chinese: 調音臺可用於各種各樣的自然吸氣和渦輪增壓引擎。

sentences.english: Inhale deeply through your nose, then exhale quickly and forcibly, also through your nose (or pursed lips).
sentences.chinese: 用鼻深吸氣，然後用鼻或撅起嘴脣使勁並快速的呼出。

sentences.english: The lack of air in the room make everyone sniffle.
sentences.chinese: 屋子裏空氣缺乏，使得每個人都頻頻吸氣。

definition: to exhale/to blow off steam/(phonetics) aspirated
to breathe out
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
arms/both arms/two arms
tongue/CL:個|个[ge4]/enemy soldier captured for the purpose of extracting information
to press/to push (a button)
to take a breath (in swimming)/to ventilate
to breathe deeply/to pant
both hands
to stretch taut/(of muscles etc) taut/strained/tense
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
to stoop
to feel dizzy/dizziness
to bend/to curve around/curved/crooked/to wind/to warp
slowly/unhurriedly/little by little
